original: Ahlin, Karl Harry, skådespelare, Göteborg, f. 14/4/00 i Sundsvall av Karl A. o. Fredrika Wilhelmina Ro- senqvist. G. 1. m. skådesp :an Gertrud Palm; 2. m. skådesp :an Doris Nelson, d. 34; 3. m. Astrid Åstrand. Barn: Barbro Margita f. 38. — Eng. s. skådesp. h. bl. a. Otto Arnolds, Leopold Edins o. Wilh. Olins sällsk. 18-22, i Finl. 23-24, h. Karin Swan-ström 25, v. Folkets Hus Teatern, Folkteatern, Södra Teatern, Djurgårdsteatern, Skansenteatern, li, Ernst Rolf, Karl Gerhard o. Pauline Bru-nius, v. Oscarsteatern o. Vasateatern, allt i Sthlm, 26-32, v. Gbgs stadsteater sed. 33. Bl. rollerna: Lancelot i Köpmannen i Venedig, Sicinius Ve-luto i Goriolanus, orgeltramparen i Kvartetten som sprängdes, styrman Karlsson i Styrman Karlssons flammor, 0’Hara i Arsenik o. gamla spetsar, Påvel i Mans kvinna. Botten vävare i En midsommarnattsdröm, David Bliss i Höfeber, Lhereaux i Ma-dame Bovary samt ett stort ant. filmroller. Medl. av Sv. teaterförb., TSO o. Göta Coldinu.
translated: Ahlin, Karl Harry, actor, Gothenburg, born April 14, 1900 in Sundsvall to Karl A. and Fredrika Wilhelmina Rosenqvist. Married 1st to actress Gertrud Palm; 2nd to actress Doris Nelson, who died in 1934; 3rd to Astrid Åstrand. Children: Barbro Margita, born in 1938. - Engaged as an actor with Otto Arnolds, Leopold Edins, and Wilh. Olins companies from 1918-1922, in Finland from 1923-1924, with Karin Swanström in 1925, with Folkets Hus Teatern, Folkteatern, Södra Teatern, Djurgårdsteatern, Skansenteatern, Ernst Rolf, Karl Gerhard and Pauline Brunius, with Oscarsteatern and Vasateatern, all in Stockholm, from 1926-1932, and with Gothenburg City Theatre since 1933. Among his roles: Lancelot in The Merchant of Venice, Sicinius Velutus in Coriolanus, the organ player in The Quartette that was Split Up, Sailor Karlsson in Karlsson-on-the-Roof, O’Hara in Arsenic and Old Lace, Påvel in Man's Woman, the Weaver in A Midsummer Night's Dream, David Bliss in Hay Fever, Lhereaux in Madame Bovary, and numerous film roles. Member of the Swedish Theatre Association, TSO and Göta Coldinu.
